channel.title: How to fix this error?
channel.description:
when i try to start my server it says this error. [img]http://img43.imageshack.us/img43/1750/errorwb.jpg[/img] i've edited these things because my current version is 6.0_27.
"C:\Program Files\Java\[b][size=12pt]jdk1.6.0_27[/size][/b]\bin\java.exe" -Xmx2500m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server
i'm on PI sources and client. Thanks,

item.title: How to fix this error?
item.dc:creator: @projeccct projeccct
item.description:
@projeccct wrote:

[quote="`SJ_, post:4, topic:417920"][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=520470.msg3780071#msg3780071 date=1318383974]
Change -Xmx2500m -cp to -Xmx500m -cp
[/quote]

Instead of spoonfeeding them all the time you should at least let them attempt to learn.

The reason behind the error is because when you are -Xmx2500m you’re allocating 2.5 gigs of ram basically. Using -Xmx500m is only allocating 500mbs of ram. 2500m is a little much especially if you’re running background programs.[/quote]

99% chance he did not read this, but a very simple fix, and easy to understand Xmx amounts, spoonfeeding is annoying.

Read full topic

item.title: How to fix this error?
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

Change -Xmx2500m -cp to -Xmx500m -cp

Instead of spoonfeeding them all the time you should at least let them attempt to learn.

The reason behind the error is because when you are -Xmx2500m you’re allocating 2.5 gigs of ram basically. Using -Xmx500m is only allocating 500mbs of ram. 2500m is a little much especially if you’re running background programs.

Read full topic
